episodeTitle: The Great Scramble for Treasure! Collapse! Spa Island!
episodeTitleJapanese: お宝大争奪戦！ 崩壊！スパアイランド号
description: The Straw Hat Pirates work to rescue Sayo from Doran and his hired accomplice Foxy. After Luffy decides to destroy Spa Island to find the missing girl, the crew defeats Doran's forces and discovers the X-shaped underwater volcano that holds the final ingredient for the rainbow gem.

events.title: Luffy Decides to Destroy Spa Island
events.description: After Lina reveals she has searched everywhere on the ship and cannot find Sayo, Luffy makes the decision to wreck Spa Island to find her. The crew begins flooding and destroying parts of the island-ship to locate the missing girl.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's willingness to take extreme action to help those in need, even if it means destroying an entire resort.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's decision to destroy Spa Island to find Sayo

events.title: Straw Hats vs. Doran's Henchmen
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates fight through Doran's hired men as they search for Sayo throughout the flooding Spa Island. Each crew member uses their abilities to defeat the henchmen.
events.significance: Shows the crew working together to rescue someone in need, demonstrating their combat skills in a filler arc.

events.title: Doran Reveals Giant Cannon with Sayo as Hostage
events.description: After the Straw Hats defeat his men, Doran unveils a massive cannon with Sayo tied up on the roof within its firing range. He demonstrates the cannon's devastating firepower to intimidate the crew.
events.significance: Escalates the tension in the arc and forces the crew to devise a rescue strategy without endangering Sayo.

events.title: Sayo Reveals Father's True Intentions
events.description: Sayo tells Lina that their father truly cared for them and that she believes his research would bear fruit. She reveals that he left to protect them from his pursuers, not because he abandoned them.
events.significance: Provides emotional depth to the filler arc and gives Lina motivation to complete her father's work.

quotes.text: Father didn't abandon us. He left to protect us!
quotes.speaker: Sayo
quotes.context: Sayo explaining their father's true motivations to Lina

events.title: Doran Demands the Research Notebook
events.description: Doran threatens to execute Sayo unless Lina hands over her father's research notebook containing the secret to creating the rainbow gem. Sayo desperately insists that Lina complete their father's research instead.
events.significance: Creates the central conflict for the climax of the episode.

events.title: Robin Uses Seis Fleur on Doran
events.description: Nico Robin uses her Seis Fleur (Six Flowers) technique to restrain Doran, holding the greedy entrepreneur down so the crew can rescue Sayo.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's Devil Fruit abilities in a tactical rescue operation.

events.title: Usopp's Special Tobasco Star Attack
events.description: Usopp shoots a Special Tobasco Star into Doran's mouth, heating it up and causing him pain, further incapacitating the villain during the rescue operation.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's creative combat tactics using his specialized ammunition.

events.title: Zoro's Dai Tetsugiri (Great Buddha Slayer)
events.description: Zoro leaps backward and performs four parallel vertical cuts with his three-sword style, slicing through Doran's giant cannon and freeing Sayo from her restraints.
events.significance: First appearance of this anime-original Three Sword Style technique, demonstrating Zoro's ability to cut through massive objects.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's attack name as he cuts the cannon

events.title: Luffy's Gear Third: Gigant Axe
events.description: In desperation, Doran releases the ship's ballast and tries to blast Luffy. Luffy dodges, activates Gear Third, and delivers a Gomu Gomu no Gigant Axe attack, crushing the cannon and splitting Spa Island in two.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's Gear Third power in the filler arc, showing the devastating force of his inflated limb attacks.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's attack that destroys the cannon and splits Spa Island

events.title: Doran's Defeat and Spa Island's Destruction
events.description: Luffy's Gigant Axe attack defeats Doran and destroys Spa Island, splitting it in half. The Straw Hat Pirates successfully rescue Sayo from the collapsing structure.
events.significance: Concludes the main conflict of the Spa Island arc with the villain's defeat and the island's destruction.

events.title: Discovery of X-Shaped Underwater Volcano
events.description: After Spa Island is destroyed, the crew notices that the X marked on Lina's father's map was pointing to an X-shaped underwater volcano opening beneath the island. The volcanic steam is the final ingredient needed for the rainbow gem.
events.significance: Solves the mystery of the father's research and provides the sisters with what they need to complete the gem.

events.title: Rainbow Effect from Volcanic Steam
events.description: The heat from the underwater lava creates steam that forms around the group. The sun's reflection through the steam causes a rainbow effect, and the sisters realize that the volcanic steam is the final ingredient to create the rainbow gem.
events.significance: Explains the scientific principle behind the father's research and completes the arc's central mystery.

events.title: Doran's Collaboration with Foxy Revealed
events.description: It is revealed that Doran had been collaborating with Foxy the Silver Fox to obtain the secret ingredient for the rainbow gem, explaining Foxy's presence at Spa Island.
events.significance: Connects the filler arc villain with a recurring antagonist from the series.

events.title: Sisters Complete the Rainbow Gem
events.description: Several days after the incident, Sayo and Lina successfully complete the rainbow gem using the volcanic steam they collected. They send the completed gem to the Straw Hat Pirates as thanks.
events.significance: Provides closure to the sisters' storyline and their father's research.

events.title: Luffy Loses the Rainbow Gem
events.description: As candy rain falls on the Thousand Sunny, Luffy accidentally loses the rainbow gem that Sayo and Lina had sent them, providing a comedic ending to the arc.
events.significance: Typical comedic Luffy moment that adds levity to the arc's conclusion.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Deciding to destroy Spa Island to find Sayo

quotes.text: Father didn't abandon us. He left to protect us!
quotes.speaker: Sayo
quotes.context: Revealing the truth about their father to Lina

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Using Three Sword Style to cut through the giant cannon

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Gear Third attack that destroys Spa Island

themes.description: The episode explores the theme of parental sacrifice as Sayo and Lina discover their father left not out of abandonment but to protect them from danger.
themes.symbolism: The rainbow gem represents the father's legacy and love for his daughters, something beautiful created from their understanding and acceptance.

themes.description: Lina's journey from doubting her father to believing in his research mirrors the importance of maintaining faith in loved ones even when circumstances seem dire.
themes.symbolism: The X on the map symbolizes the hidden truth that was always there, waiting to be understood.

themes.description: The Straw Hats demonstrate their core values by immediately helping Sayo and Lina, even destroying an entire island resort without hesitation.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's willingness to wreck Spa Island shows that true heroes prioritize people over property.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his straightforward approach to problems by deciding to destroy the entire island to find Sayo, then uses Gear Third to defeat Doran decisively.
keyActions: Decides to wreck Spa Island to find Sayo
Uses Gear Third: Gigant Axe to destroy the cannon and defeat Doran
Accidentally loses the rainbow gem at the end

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro showcases a new anime-original technique to cut through the giant cannon and rescue Sayo.
keyActions: Agrees with Luffy's plan to destroy Spa Island
Uses Dai Tetsugiri to slice through Doran's cannon
Frees Sayo from her restraints

characterSpotlights.development: Robin uses her Devil Fruit abilities strategically to restrain Doran during the rescue operation.
keyActions: Uses Seis Fleur to hold Doran down
Provides tactical support during the rescue

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates his creative combat style with specialized ammunition.
keyActions: Shoots Special Tobasco Star at Doran
Helps incapacitate the villain

characterSpotlights.development: Sayo reveals the truth about her father's intentions, providing emotional depth and motivation for completing the research.
keyActions: Held hostage by Doran on the cannon
Reveals father's true intentions to Lina
Encourages Lina to complete their father's research
Later completes the rainbow gem with Lina
quotes: Father didn't abandon us. He left to protect us!

characterSpotlights.development: Lina learns the truth about her father and gains the motivation to complete his research.
keyActions: Searches desperately for Sayo
Learns the truth about her father
Completes the rainbow gem with Sayo's help

characterSpotlights.development: Doran serves as the greedy villain whose schemes are foiled by the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Takes Sayo hostage
Threatens to execute Sayo with his giant cannon
Is defeated by the combined efforts of the Straw Hats

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Spa Island arc is anime-original filler content and does not appear in the manga.
Zoro's Dai Tetsugiri technique is anime-only and does not exist in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 383 is part of the Spa Island Arc, which is the first filler arc to include Brook as a member of the Straw Hat Pirates.

sources.title: Spa Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode aired on December 28, 2008 in Japan and received a TV rating of 6.8%.
This episode features no ending theme song, as Toei Animation stopped airing ending themes from Episode 279 to Episode 1070 to allow for longer openings.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The opening theme 'We Are! (Remix)' by Tohoshinki was created to commemorate the 10th anniversary of the One Piece anime.

sources.title: We Are! Tohoshinki Remix - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Spa Island Arc is the second shortest filler arc in One Piece at only three episodes (382-384).

sources.title: Spa Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The eyecatcher for this episode features Luffy and Franky.
